title: davidnaam
author: davidnaam
content: Hello,I'm planning to buy a new graphics card for alt coins mining. Can anyone please guide me suitable graphics card for either 10GB or 12GB memory? Also, estimate price too.ThanksDavid

comments.author: hymperion
comments.body: hello, 6GB is enough to date to mine all the coins. The GPUs with the best price / performance and efficiency ratio are the 3070 and the 3060ti

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: The price is a bit wonky these days. I suggest you also wait for the new release of GPU from Nvidia or AMD before you purchase unless your local market price is very good. Make sure to calculate your theoretical profit too before buying any gpu so you won't be faced with unexpected power consumption with little to no profit.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: If you provide us more information, we can help you in a better way, because there's several things happening right now:ETH the main altcoin to mine is changing to POS, and another coins can't absorb the hashrate of ETH without harming profits, there's only a few days left to mine ETH, so it's wise to wait just a couple more days, 2 weeks at least.Nvidia can reduce prices even further and pre owned markets can be flooded again.But if you want to buy no matter what, 3060ti, 3070 and even 3080 are good choices of cards that mine most algos, not only Ethash, and a possible better value to resell.You need to compare prices too.Please, post here about the prices of GPUs in your country, and if you're planning to mine with a single card, a rig etc...

comments.author: davidnaam
comments.body: Hello Fellow Friends,Thanks for your reply. I searched for some info based on your input and found "GIGABYTE GeForce RTX 3060 Eagle OC 12G (REV2.0) Graphics Card with 2X WINDFORCE Fans, 12 GB 192-bit GDDR6, GV-N3060EAGLE OC-12GD REV2.0 Video Card, pci_e_x16" at price of US$511 including all taxes and shipping charges.Model No.: GV-N3060EAGLE OC-12GD REV2.0Memory clock speed: 15000 MHzI understand that mining alt coins will be profitable after a couple of years when the price of alt coins will increase. I will start with just 1 graphics card now. The price of 3070, 3080, 3060ti are little bit expensive and offers RAM 8Gb - 10GB. And above card gives 12GB RAM at lesser price.So, please give your opinion on this card.ThanksDavid

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: davidnaam on September 09, 2022, 01:24:01 PMHello Fellow Friends,Thanks for your reply. I searched for some info based on your input and found "GIGABYTE GeForce RTX 3060 Eagle OC 12G (REV2.0) Graphics Card with 2X WINDFORCE Fans, 12 GB 192-bit GDDR6, GV-N3060EAGLE OC-12GD REV2.0 Video Card, pci_e_x16" at price of US$511 including all taxes and shipping charges.Model No.: GV-N3060EAGLE OC-12GD REV2.0Memory clock speed: 15000 MHzI understand that mining alt coins will be profitable after a couple of years when the price of alt coins will increase. I will start with just 1 graphics card now. The price of 3070, 3080, 3060ti are little bit expensive and offers RAM 8Gb - 10GB. And above card gives 12GB RAM at lesser price.So, please give your opinion on this card.ThanksDavidThe Vram does not mean a lot in mining.It is the cuda cores (Nvidia cards) that do the job in mining mostly so it means that the 3060 despite being 12 GB will give an hash rate of 49 Mhsh while the 3070 despite being 8 GB will give an hash rate of 62 Mhsh.The best card from the ones mentioned is the 3060 ti as it has the lowest power consumption at 115-120 watt and giving you 60-61 Mhsh but of course that depend on the price difference,even 3060 as a starting card is a great one so buy based on your budget but I wanted to make it clear to you that the VRAM is not what is the most important part despite being important as a 4GB card cannot mine Ethereum for example.
